intro: Micranthes greenei, commonly known as the Greene's micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
